summary: The text discusses events related to the history of the Jewish people, particularly during the time of Antiochus Epiphanes when some Jews allied with him against their own people. It references the Maccabean revolts, conflicts between Hyrcanus and Alexander, and the subsequent capture of Jerusalem by Pompey, which led to Roman control. The text also highlights the later destruction of Jerusalem under Titus and Vespasian, and its final devastation under Emperor Hadrian when the city was completely razed and lost its original name.
